intro: Oenanthe biebersteinii f. hungarica, commonly known as the Hungarian water dropwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to moist environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a distinctive pungent odor, while the flowers are small and white or greenish. This subspecies is noted for its ecological importance in wetland ecosystems.
